basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ Hi, I'm Utkarsh Nigam, a passionate and innovative software developer with over 4 years of experience in building scalable web and mobile applications. I specialize in backend development, cloud infrastructure, and creating seamless user experiences using technologies like Java, C#, Python, Spring, React, AWS, and Azure. Currently, I'm working at Microsoft in the Dataverse team for Dynamics 365 FnO, where I focus on data import/export systems and use automation and AI to reduce operational noise and improve SLA metrics. Previously, I was at Amazon, where I played a key role in designing and launching a notifications service used by clients to manage, schedule, and monitor messages with high reliability and usability. Beyond work, I enjoy exploring topics in machine learning, data science, and system design. Iâ€™m driven by curiosity and love mentoring others, solving complex problems, and contributing to impactful products.

projects.title: ProClip
projects.description: A clipboard manager that helps users to manage their clipboard data(text and images). It ensures that all copied information is securely stored for a period ranging from 30 to 90 days. This feature guarantees that users can access their clipboard history even after restarting their devices.ProClip offers a user-friendly interface with a chronological order of stored data, making it easy to track and retrieve past entries. Additionally, the integrated search bar allows users to quickly find specific items within their clipboard history, enhancing productivity and efficiency

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
